intro: Oxyceros sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and hairy, glandular stems. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
